title: Drawing, "Mausoleum", 1790
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite on paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; 1938: acquired by Museum (from Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The precinct is shown partly in elevations, partly in sections. A ramp beside a platform with a pavilion and a pyramid leads to the entrance of a pavilion similar to the one described first. At left, beside it, is a colonnade with monuments adjacent to a steeple. At left, a staircase of the steeple leads to the vaulted basement below the steeple, colonnade and pavilion to the floors of the monuments. The building of a pavilion. Bottom row: at left, a bedstead, and a child in it, in the shape of a ship, on a platform. Center: a trough-like cradle. At right: a kind of bowl is supported by chimeras, upon a platform.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Mausoleum", 1790.Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1180.
